intro: Amoora spectabilis, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds. Amoora spectabilis thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests.
